You can use the online contact form below, where your message will be dealt with as appropriate, or alternatively contact us on the telephone numbers below. Honorary Secretary , Peter Mahoney: Tel: 01702 526 911 You may complete this form to send an email directly to Belfairs Golf Club. Alternatively, you can send an email to the following email address: info@belfairsgolfclub.co.uk . Contact Form Name Email Phone Subject **Please select an option** Clubhouse General Membership Members Website Account Request a Handicap Certificate Visitor Message Please do not provide anything sensitive here, like health details, or your credit card number. Verification We do not support SPAM and we would never sell your information to anyone. Any correspondence is strictly confidential. We will only use the above information to contact you about your query. Address Belfairs Golf Club Eastwood Road North Leigh-on-Sea Essex SS9 4LR Contact phone: 01702 526 911 email: info@belfairsgolfclub.co.uk Tee Times phone: 01702 525 345 Links RSS Feed Cookie and Privacy Contact Us Map/Directions Copyright © Belfairs Golf Club , 2011-2025. Bartow Golf Course, Bartow, FL - Scorecard & Overview Join Now Log In Book a Tee Time Find a Course Learn Equipment Instruction Lifestyle Tour Golf Travel All Articles Resources Find Driving Ranges Find Golf Simulators About Us Find golf lessons Newsletter Join Now Log In Newsletter Search Courses Enter Keyword Home Courses FL Bartow Public 3.5 1 Review Bartow Golf Course Opened in 1921 Bartow - Bartow , Florida Course Details Scorecard Flyover Views Yardage Maps Reviews Course Details Holes: 18 Par: 72 Length: 6613 yards Slope: 126 Rating: 72.1 Driving Ranges: Yes The 18-hole "Bartow" course at the Bartow Golf Course facility in Bartow , Florida features 6613 yards of golf from the longest tees for a par of 72. The course rating is 72.1 and it has a slope rating of 126. The estimated green fees for 18 holes is $25. Bartow Golf Course Golf Club has an onsite driving range with 6 practice tees. The Bartow golf course opened in  1921. Estimated Green Fees $25 These rates are an estimate of what you might expect to pay at Bartow with a cart. Actual rates may vary. Fees are typically lowest Monday through Thursday and during twilight (late afternoon and evenings). Expect to pay the highest rates on weekends. FRONT 9 BACK 9 HOLE 1 HOLE 2 HOLE 3 HOLE 4 HOLE 5 HOLE 6 HOLE 7 HOLE 8 HOLE 9 Load More Holes HOLE 10 HOLE 11 HOLE 12 HOLE 13 HOLE 14 HOLE 15 HOLE 16 HOLE 17 HOLE 18 What Golfers are Saying 3.5 Based on 1 Review Write a review Add a Photo Drop Photo Here or Click to Upload Submit Austin W. Reviewed November 09, 2011 Pretty good municipal course.   The layout is nothing special, pretty much what you would expect, but they keep it in better shape than some of the "nicer" courses in the area.  It is a pretty easy course, with few hazards and most holes with adjacant fairways that are not OOB.  It is an enjoyable round of golf, pace of play can be problematic at times.  The rate is very reasonable, making it worth every penny spent. Bartow Golf Course, Bartow, FL - Albrecht Golf Guide Golf Courses Golf Hotels Golf Packages Bookshop Apps Sign in / Sign up Saved Items Deutsch English Español Italiano Albrecht Golf Guide Golf courses in North America United States Florida Bartow Golf Course 18 Hole Semi- Private Overview Course Visitors Prices Amenities Reviews No image available Bartow Golf Course 190 S Idlewood Ave, Bartow, FL 33830-4244, USA Phone: +1 863-533-9183 , Fax: +1 863-519-3758 mhopkins.golf@cityofbartow.net www.cityofbartow.net Map Save Share 3.0 of 5 stars 1 Review The Course 18-Hole Course Driving Range  &  Practice area Visitors welcome? Yes - every day. Season: Year round Green fees $25 - 30 (21-26 €) / 18 Holes The Course 18-Hole Course Opened in 1921. Design: Donald Ross . Style: Parkland. Terrain: Water hazards Technical difficulty: Moderate Scorecard Tee Par CR Slope Length Blue (Men) 72 72 126 6613 yards White (Men) 72 70.3 123 6241 yards Yellow (Men) 72 66.2 112 5711 yards Red (Women) 72 69.8 120 5349 yards Practice Facilities Driving Range Putting Green Chipping Green Visitors 18-Hole Course Visitors are welcome every day. Amenities Club Amenities Clubhouse Club accepts credit cards Pro Shop Bar Snack Bar Rentals Clubs for hire Trolley for hire Electro-cart for hire Enlarge / get directions Nearby Courses The Club at Eaglebrooke Lakeland (13 km) 18 Hole 59-68 € / 18 Holes Sanlan Golf Course Lakeland (14 km) 27 Hole 22-26 € / 18 Holes Angler's Green Golf Course Mulberry (16 km) 9 Hole See all User Reviews 3.0 of 5 stars 1 Review 5 Stars: 0 4 Stars: 0 3 Stars: 1 2 Stars: 0 1 star: 0 Write a Review Most Recent Reviews pitchmark 388 Reviews Automatic translation Original version Florida Historic Golf Trail 3.0 of 5 stars Reviewed April 29, 2024 A Donald Ross design that opened in 1925 as an 18 hole course, originally built as a 9 hole course in 1919. The Scotsman from Dornoch worked in the golden age of golf course construction, employed over 2000 people and left his mark on more than 500 courses. He built three courses in Pinhurst alone - where he last lived. It is not clear whether he ever visited this course - it is said that he never saw a third of all the courses, which is not surprising given the travel conditions at the time. Due to the size of the greens, the course was initially played on oiled sand greens. Grass greens were not built until the mid-1930s. It's great to breathe, feel and play old golf air here. They are proud of the designer, the name is clearly visible from the street. The course has been preserved in its original form, almost all holes are straight. Completely flat fairways, small greens and small bunkers, and hardly any fairway bunkers. Visible renovations are the water barriers, which serve for drainage and were realized much later. The development from foot golf to driving golf is visible... The flat course plays as a "links loop" and is not that long at just over 320 meters per hole. Nevertheless, it proved to be a tough nut to crack, because the playing surface was soft - hardly any free meters - and playing the dome greens - one of Donald Ross' trademarks - was extremely difficult. They are significantly smaller than average, even small, and getting the ball to stop was the big challenge. Maintenance is largely rustic - as it was in the early days - the greens are good, with very good speed. WebPage Address: www. bartowgolfclub. com Translated by Google . Been to Bartow Golf Course ? Share your experiences!
